   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between two Diameter nodes, the client being
   23: %% spread across three Erlang nodes.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_distribution_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([
   33:          %% Framework functions
   34:          suite/0,
   35:          all/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38: 
   39:          %% The test cases
   40:          traffic/1
   41:         ]).
   42: 
   43: %% rpc calls
   44: -export([ping/1,
   45:          start/1,
   46:          stop/1,
   47:          connect/1,
   48:          call/1]).
   49: 
   50: %% diameter callbacks
   51: -export([peer_up/3,
   52:          peer_down/3,
   53:          pick_peer/5,
   54:          prepare_request/4,
   55:          prepare_retransmit/4,
   56:          handle_answer/5,
   57:          handle_error/5,
   58:          handle_request/3]).
   59: 
   60: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   61: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc6733.hrl").
   62: 
   63: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   64: 
   65: 
   66: %% ===========================================================================
   67: 
   68: -define(DL(F),    ?DL(F, [])).
   69: -define(DL(F, A), ?LOG("DDISTRS", F, A)).
   70: 
   71: -define(CLIENT, 'CLIENT').
   72: -define(SERVER, 'SERVER').
   73: -define(REALM, "erlang.org").
   74: -define(DICT, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733).
   75: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   76: 
   77: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   78: -define(SERVICE(Host),
   79:         [{'Origin-Host', Host ++ [$.|?REALM]},
   80:          {'Origin-Realm', ?REALM},
   81:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   82:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   83:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   84:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [?DICT:id()]},
   85:          {'Origin-State-Id', origin()},
   86:          {share_peers, peers()},
   87:          {use_shared_peers, peers()},
   88:          {restrict_connections, false},
   89:          {spawn_opt, {diameter_dist, spawn_local, []}},
   90:          {sequence, fun sequence/0},
   91:          {application, [{dictionary, ?DICT},
   92:                         {module, ?MODULE},
   93:                         {request_errors, callback},
   94:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
   95: 
   96: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
   97: -define(BUSY,    3004).
   98: -define(LOGOUT,  ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
   99: -define(MOVED,   ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_USER_MOVED').
  100: -define(TIMEOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_SESSION_TIMEOUT').
  101: 
  102: -define(L, atom_to_list).
  103: -define(A, list_to_atom).
  104: 
  105: %% The order here is significant and causes the server to listen
  106: %% before the clients connect.
  107: -define(NODES, [{server,  ?SERVER},
  108:                 {client0, ?CLIENT},
  109:                 {client1, ?CLIENT},
  110:                 {client2, ?CLIENT}]).
  111: 
  112: 
  113: %% ===========================================================================
  114: 
  115: suite() ->
  116:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  117: 
  118: all() ->
  119:     [traffic].
  120: 
  121: 
  122: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  123:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
  124: 
  125: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  126:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  127: 
  128: 
  129: traffic(Config) ->
  130:     ?DL("traffic -> entry"),
  131:     Factor = dia_factor(Config),
  132:     Res = do_traffic(Factor),
  133:     ?DL("traffic -> done when"
  134:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  135:     Res.
  136: 
  137: 
  138: %% ===========================================================================
  139: 
  140: run() ->
  141:     [] = ?RUN([{fun() -> do_traffic(1) end, 60000}]).
  142:     %% process for linked peers to die with
  143: 
  144: %% traffic/0
  145: 
  146: do_traffic(Factor) ->
  147:     ?DL("do_traffic -> make sure we have distro"),
  148:     true = is_alive(),  %% need distribution for peer nodes
  149:     ?DL("do_traffic -> get nodes"),
  150:     Nodes = enslave(),
  151:     ?DL("do_traffic -> ping nodes"),
  152:     [] = ping(Nodes),  %% drop client node
  153:     ?DL("do_traffic -> start nodes"),
  154:     [] = start(Nodes),
  155:     ?DL("do_traffic -> connect nodes"),
  156:     [_] = connect(Nodes),
  157:     ?DL("do_traffic -> send (to) nodes"),
  158:     [] = send(Nodes, Factor),
  159:     ?DL("do_traffic -> stop nodes"),
  160:     [] = stop(Nodes),
  161:     ?DL("do_traffic -> done"),
  162:     ok.
  163: 
  164: %% enslave/0
  165: %%
  166: %% Start four nodes;
  167: %%   - one to implement a Diameter server,
  168: %%   - three to implement a client.
  169: 
  170: enslave() ->
  171:     Here = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  172:     Ebin = filename:join([Here, "..", "ebin"]),
  173:     Args = ["-pa", Here, Ebin],
  174:     [{N,S} || {M,S} <- ?NODES, N <- [start(M, Args)]].
  175: 
  176: start(Name, Args) ->
  177:     {ok, _, Node} = ?DUTIL:peer(#{name => Name, args => Args}),
  178:     Node.
  179: 
  180: %% ping/1
  181: %%
  182: %% Ensure the client nodes are connected since the sharing of
  183: %% transports is only between connected nodes.
  184: 
  185: ping({?SERVER, _Nodes}) ->
  186:     [];
  187: 
  188: ping({?CLIENT, Nodes}) ->
  189:     [N || {N,_} <- Nodes,
  190:           node() /= N,
  191:           pang <- [net_adm:ping(N)]];
  192: 
  193: ping(Nodes) ->
  194:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  195:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, ping, [{S, Nodes}])],
  196:                RC /= []].
  197: 
  198: %% start/1
  199: %%
  200: %% Start diameter services.
  201: 
  202: start(SvcName)
  203:   when is_atom(SvcName) ->
  204:     ok = diameter:start(),
  205:     ok = diameter:start_service(SvcName, ?SERVICE((?L(SvcName))));
  206: 
  207: start(Nodes) ->
  208:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  209:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start, [S])],
  210:                RC /= ok].
  211: 
  212: %% stop/1
  213: %%
  214: %% Stop diameter services.
  215: 
  216: stop(SvcName)
  217:   when is_atom(SvcName) ->
  218:     ok = diameter:stop_service(SvcName),
  219:     ok = diameter:stop();
  220: 
  221: stop(Nodes) ->
  222:     [{N,RC} || {N,S} <- Nodes,
  223:                RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop, [S])],
  224:                RC /= ok].
  225: 
  226: sequence() ->
  227:     sequence(sname()).
  228: 
  229: sequence(server) ->
  230:     {0,32};
  231: sequence(Client) ->
  232:     "client" ++ N = ?L(Client),
  233:     {list_to_integer(N), 30}.
  234: 
  235: origin() ->
  236:     origin(sname()).
  237: 
  238: origin(server) ->
  239:     99;
  240: origin(Client) ->
  241:     "client" ++ N = ?L(Client),
  242:     list_to_integer(N).
  243: 
  244: peers() ->
  245:     peers(sname()).
  246: 
  247: peers(server)  -> true;
  248: peers(client0) -> [node() | nodes()];
  249: peers(client1) -> fun erlang:nodes/0;
  250: peers(client2) -> nodes().
  251: 
  252: %% connect/1
  253: %%
  254: %% Establish one connection to the server from each of the client
  255: %% nodes.
  256: 
  257: connect({?SERVER, _, []}) ->
  258:     [_LRef = ?LISTEN(?SERVER, tcp)];
  259: 
  260: connect({?CLIENT, [{Node, _} | _], [LRef] = Acc}) ->
  261:     ?CONNECT(?CLIENT, tcp, {Node, LRef}),
  262:     Acc;
  263: 
  264: connect(Nodes) ->
  265:     lists:foldl(fun({N,S}, A) ->
  266:                         rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, connect, [{S, Nodes, A}])
  267:                 end,
  268:                 [],
  269:                 Nodes).
  270: 
  271: %% ===========================================================================
  272: 
  273: %% send/2
  274: 
  275: send(Nodes, Factor) ->
  276:     ?RUN([[fun send/3, Nodes, T, Factor]
  277:           || T <- [local, remote, timeout, failover]]).
  278: 
  279: %% send/3
  280: 
  281: %% Send a request from the first client node, using a the local
  282: %% transport.
  283: send(Nodes, local, Factor) ->
  284:     ?DL("send(local) -> entry - expect success (~p)", [?SUCCESS]),
  285:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  286:         = send(Nodes, 0, str(?LOGOUT), Factor),
  287:     ?DL("send(local) -> success (=success)"),
  288:     ok;
  289: 
  290: %% Send a request from the first client node, using a transport on the
  291: %% another node.
  292: send(Nodes, remote, Factor) ->
  293:     ?DL("send(remote) -> entry - expect success (~p)", [?SUCCESS]),
  294:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS}
  295:         = send(Nodes, 1, str(?LOGOUT), Factor),
  296:     ?DL("send(remote) -> success (=success)"),
  297:     ok;
  298: 
  299: %% Send a request that the server discards.
  300: send(Nodes, timeout, Factor) ->
  301:     ?DL("send(timeout) -> entry - expect timeout"),
  302:     {error, timeout} = send(Nodes, 1, str(?TIMEOUT), Factor),
  303:     ?DL("send(timeout) -> success (=timeout)"),
  304:     ok;
  305: 
  306: %% Send a request that causes the server to take the transport down.
  307: send(Nodes, failover, Factor) ->
  308:     ?DL("send(failover) -> entry - expect busy (~p)", [?BUSY]),
  309:     #'diameter_base_answer-message'{'Result-Code' = ?BUSY}
  310:         = send(Nodes, 2, str(?MOVED), Factor),
  311:     ?DL("send(failover) -> success (=busy)"),
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: 
  315: %% ===========================================================================
  316: 
  317: str(Cause) ->
  318:     #diameter_base_STR{'Destination-Realm'   = ?REALM,
  319:                        'Auth-Application-Id' = ?DICT:id(),
  320:                        'Termination-Cause'   = Cause}.
  321: 
  322: %% send/4
  323: 
  324: %% There is a "bug" in diameter, which can cause this function to return
  325: %% {error, timeout} even though only a fraction on the time has expired.
  326: %% This is because the timer has in fact *not* expired. Instead what
  327: %% has happened is the transport process has died and the selection
  328: %% of a new transport fails (I think its a race causing the pick_peer
  329: %% to return the same tranport process), at that error is converted to
  330: %% a timeout error.
  331: %% So, if this call returns {error, timeout} but only a fraction of the
  332: %% time has passed we skip instead!
  333: send([_, {Node, _} | _], Where, Req, Factor) ->
  334:     ?DL("send -> make rpc call to node ~p", [Node]),
  335:     case rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, call, [{Where, Req, Factor}]) of
  336:         {{error, timeout} = Result, T1, T2, Timeout}
  337:           when is_integer(T1) andalso is_integer(T2) ->
  338:             TDiff = T2 - T1,
  339:             ?DL("request completed:"
  340:                 "~n   Time:    ~w msec"
  341:                 "~n   Timeout: ~w msec"
  342:                 "~n   Result:  ~p", [TDiff, Timeout, Result]),
  343:             if
  344:                 (TDiff < 100) ->
  345:                     exit({skip, {invalid_timeout, TDiff, Timeout}});
  346:                 true ->
  347:                     Result
  348:             end;
  349:         {Result, T1, T2, Timeout} when is_integer(T1) andalso is_integer(T2) ->
  350:             ?DL("request completed:"
  351:                 "~n   Time:    ~w msec"
  352:                 "~n   Timeout: ~w msec"
  353:                 "~n   Result:  ~p", [T2-T1, Timeout, Result]),
  354:             Result;
  355:         {badrpc, Reason} ->
  356:             ?DL("rpc failed:"
  357:                 "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
  358:             ct:fail({rpc_call_failed, Node, Where, Req, Reason})
  359:     end.
  360: 
  361: %% call/1
  362: 
  363: call({Where, Req, Factor}) ->
  364:     Timeout = timeout(Factor),
  365:     ?DL("call -> make diameter call with"
  366:         "~n   (own) Node: ~p"
  367:         "~n   Where:      ~p"
  368:         "~n   Req:        ~p"
  369:         "~nwhen"
  370:         "~n   Timeout:    ~w (~w)", [node(), Where, Req, Timeout, Factor]),
  371:     T1 = ?TS(),
  372:     Result = diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?DICT, Req, [{extra, [{Where, sname()}]},
  373:                                                  {timeout, Timeout}]),
  374:     T2 = ?TS(),
  375:     ?DL("call -> diameter call ended with"
  376:         "~n   Result: ~p"
  377:         "~nwhen"
  378:         "~n   T2-T1:  ~w (~w - ~w)", [Result, T2 - T1, T2, T1]),
  379:     {Result, T1, T2, Timeout}.
  380: 
  381: %% sname/0
  382: 
  383: sname() ->
  384:     ?A(hd(string:tokens(?L(node()), "@"))).
  385: 
  386: 
  387: %% ===========================================================================
  388: %% diameter callbacks
  389: 
  390: %% peer_up/3
  391: 
  392: peer_up(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  393:     State.
  394: 
  395: %% peer_down/3
  396: 
  397: peer_down(_SvcName, _Peer, State) ->
  398:     State.
  399: 
  400: %% pick_peer/4
  401: 
  402: pick_peer([LP], _, ?CLIENT, _State, {0, client0}) ->
  403:     {ok, LP};
  404: 
  405: pick_peer(_, Peers, ?CLIENT, _State, {1, client0}) ->
  406:     [RP] = [T || {_, #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {[1],_}}} = T <- Peers],
  407:     {ok, RP};
  408: 
  409: %% Sending on the remote transport causes the server to take the
  410: %% transport down. Retransmission on the local.
  411: pick_peer(LP, RP, ?CLIENT, _State, {2, client0}) ->
  412:     {ok, case [T || {_, #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {[2],_}}} = T <- RP] of
  413:              [T] ->
  414:                  T;
  415:              _ ->
  416:                  hd([_] = LP)
  417:          end}.
  418: 
  419: %% prepare_request/4
  420: 
  421: prepare_request(Pkt, ?CLIENT, {_Ref, Caps}, {_, client0}) ->
  422:     #diameter_packet{msg = Req}
  423:         = Pkt,
  424:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  425:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  426:         = Caps,
  427:     {send, Req#diameter_base_STR{'Origin-Host' = OH,
  428:                                  'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  429:                                  'Session-Id' = diameter:session_id(OH)}}.
  430: 
  431: %% prepare_retransmit/4
  432: 
  433: prepare_retransmit(Pkt, ?CLIENT, _, {_, client0}) ->
  434:     #diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Termination-Cause' = ?MOVED}}
  435:         = Pkt,  %% assert
  436:     {send, Pkt}.
  437: 
  438: %% handle_answer/5
  439: 
  440: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer, {_, client0}) ->
  441:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  442:     Rec.
  443: 
  444: %% handle_error/5
  445: 
  446: handle_error(Reason, _Req, ?CLIENT = Svc, _Peer, {_, client0}) ->
  447:     ?DL("~w(~p) -> entry with"
  448:         "~n   Reason: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Svc, Reason]),
  449:     {error, Reason}.
  450: 
  451: %% handle_request/3
  452: 
  453: handle_request(Pkt, ?SERVER, Peer) ->
  454:     server = sname(),  %% assert
  455:     #diameter_packet{msg = Req}
  456:         = Pkt,
  457:     request(Req, Peer).
  458: 
  459: request(#diameter_base_STR{'Termination-Cause' = ?TIMEOUT}, _) ->
  460:     discard;
  461: 
  462: request(#diameter_base_STR{'Termination-Cause' = ?MOVED}, Peer) ->
  463:     {TPid, #diameter_caps{origin_state_id = {_, [N]}}} = Peer,
  464:     fail(N, TPid);
  465: 
  466: request(#diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}, {_, Caps}) ->
  467:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  468:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  469:         = Caps,
  470:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  471:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  472:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  473:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR}}.
  474: 
  475: fail(0, _) ->     %% sent from the originating node ...
  476:     {protocol_error, ?BUSY};
  477: 
  478: fail(_, TPid) ->  %% ... or through a remote node: force failover
  479:     exit(TPid, kill),
  480:     discard.
  481: 
  482: 
  483: %% ===========================================================================
  484: 
  485: -define(CALL_TO_DEFAULT, 5000).
  486: timeout(Factor) when (Factor > 0) andalso (Factor =< 20) ->
  487:     (Factor - 1) * 500 + ?CALL_TO_DEFAULT;
  488: timeout(Factor) when (Factor > 0) ->
  489:     3*?CALL_TO_DEFAULT. % Max at 15 seconds
  490: 
  491: 
  492: %% ===========================================================================
  493: 
  494: dia_factor(Config) ->
  495:     config_lookup(?FUNCTION_NAME, Config).
  496: 
  497: config_lookup(Key, Config) ->
  498:     {value, {Key, Value}} = lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config),
  499:     Value.
